item.title: 'Strong labour-market institutions vital to prosperity'
item.description: Guy Ryder, ILO director-general, outlines the challenge of ensuring decent work for all at a time of global uncertainty.

item.title: NewsGrid - Al Jazeera's interactive news hour
item.description: Live every day at 15:00 GMT, our interactive news bulletin gives you the opportunity to engage with our team directly.

item.title: German police step up manhunt after Berlin truck attack
item.description: Perpetrator on the run after ramming truck through Berlin Christmas market, killing 12 and wounding dozens.

item.title: Arctic outbreak, then La Nina warming in North America
item.description: The sudden and severe wintry spell in both the US and Canada may be the only one of this season as La Nina takes over.

item.title: Increasing number of deaths among Nepali workers
item.description: Despite the rising number of deaths caused mainly by heart attacks, an increasing number of Nepalese seek work overseas.

item.title: We're thinking about happiness all wrong
item.description: Polish philosopher Zygmunt Bauman explains the problem.

item.title: Donald Trump's cabinet bodes ill for the planet
item.description: The president-elect's appointments make it clear that we cannot rely on the government to protect the planet.

item.title: Study: Rates of US execution sharply decline in 2016
item.description: Legal battles and the shortage of drugs needed for lethal injection meant just five of 31 US states executed inmates.

item.title: Defiant Gambian president refuses to step aside
item.description: Yahya Jammeh reiterates he won't hand over power to President-elect Adama Barrow despite growing international pressure.

item.title: ISIL targets civilians who refused to join Mosul battle
item.description: Human Rights Watch says civilians are increasingly coming into the crossfire between the armed group and Iraqi troops.

item.title: Wau displaced tell of death and horrifying escapes
item.description: UN warns of ethnic cleansing under way in South Sudan, survivors recount how they escaped as violence erupted in Wau.

item.title: Indonesia police kill suspects plotting holiday attacks
item.description: Police in Jakarta kill three allegedly planning a suicide attack over the Christmas and new year period.

item.title: Unification: Saladin and the Fall of Jerusalem
item.description: We explore how Salah Ed-Din unified the Muslim states and recaptured the holy city of Jerusalem from the crusaders.

item.title: Taiwan slams Sao Tome's decision to cut diplomatic ties
item.description: "Abrupt" move to break diplomatic relations condemned by Taipei as main rival China gleefully welcomes the decision.

item.title: Berlin attack: Community spirit and resilience prevail
item.description: "Staying at home being afraid is the wrong way to handle this... that's what these people attacking us want."

item.title: From the rubble of Aleppo, ISIL rises
item.description: Through distraction, rival elimination and fears of the Sunni population, ISIL seizes opportunities of Aleppo's war.

item.title: More than two dozen people killed in DRC protests
item.description: Fears grow after Human Rights Watch reports at least 26 people killed in demonstrations as Joseph Kabila refuses to go.

item.title: Mexico fireworks market blast kills at least 31
item.description: About 70 injured in the huge explosion - the third in a decade to hit the popular San Pablito marketplace in Tultepec.

item.title: UN pushes for murder probe into Rodrigo Duterte
item.description: President admitted last week to "personally" killing three men as mayor of Davao City during a gunfight in the 1980s.

item.title: US and Canada prevent oil drilling in Arctic waters
item.description: Obama made the move under an obscure provision of a 1953 law with no way for future presidents to roll it back.

item.title: Israel's Jordan Valley regulation 'discriminatory'
item.description: A labour regulation affecting the lives of thousands of Palestinian workers has limited their access to courts.

item.title: Russia joins investigation into Ankara assassination
item.description: Seven detained in connection with killing of ambassador Andrey Karlov as Russia and Turkey attempt to contain fallout.

item.title: ISIL makes Berlin attack claim amid hunt for suspects
item.description: Group describes perpetrator of Christmas market attack as "soldier of Islamic State" while investigators "pursue leads".

item.title: Pakistan's electronic media faces ethics questions
item.description: After PIA plane crash, broadcast media is accused of encouraging sensationalism for ratings instead of good reporting.

item.title: Suspect in Berlin Christmas market attack released
item.description: Attacker could still be on the run, Germany's interior minister says following release of a Pakistani refugee suspect.
